intro: Barnadesia venosa, commonly known as the veined barnadesia, is a flowering plant native to South America. It belongs to the family Malvaceae, which includes hibiscus and cotton. The plant is characterized by its striking, velvety leaves with prominent veins and showy, pale pink to white flowers. It thrives in moist, well-drained soils and is often found in shaded forest understories. Due to its unique appearance, it is a popular choice for ornamental gardening in tropical and subtropical regions.
